alert.note: Alert for Central Willamette Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 28 at 5:11AM PST until further notice by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Luckiamute River near Suver affecting Central Willamette Valley zone. S Yamhill River at McMinnville affecting Central Willamette Valley zone. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Luckiamute River near Suver. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Above 27.0 feet, expect flooding of low lying and agricultural lands in the vicinity of Sarah Helmick State Park, Highway 99W, and Parker Road. Some secondary roads and rural access roads may be flooded at this point. Flooding along Buena Vista Rd near the confluence with the Willamette is also likely, especially if the Willamette is running high. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:11 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 22.1 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 115 PM PST.
